title: Feature values not showing
body:
Hi,

I have two issues, probably related. 

I'm running the basic example in the Readme and force_plot throws an error with ```shap.force_plot(explainer.expected_value, shap_values[0,:],...)``` seemingly because it expects to be able to slice an np array (which the code suggests is what force_plot expects), however the output in the previous part of ```shap_values = explainer.shap_values(scaled_x)``` seems to return a list.

My X values are an np.array because they come from StandardScaler though putting them into a df doesn't seem to help. 

What does appear to work is the following code

```python
def shap_explain(clf,scaled_x, cols,label):
	shap.initjs()
	explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(clf)
	shap_values = explainer.shap_values(scaled_x[1])

	plot = shap.force_plot(explainer.expected_value[0], shap_values[0], feature_names = cols, show = False)

	shap.save_html(f'explainer_{label}.html', plot)
```

however i am quite confused by the issues of dimensionality. For now I only want to display 1 prediction which this does but only if i subselect my data, as opposed to computing it for all the data and then subselecting in the plot as the readme example suggests (which throws a slicing error)

More to the point, while the above code outputs the plot for a single prediction, it doesn't show the feature values, just the labels - how do i fix this?

Thanks!
